intro: Drypetes major, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and dense, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
